subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Creationism: Taking Genesis Literally
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Creationism: Taking Genesis Literally.

hook.text: God made the world in six days, 6,000 years ago. Millions believe it. The science says otherwise. Who's right?

buildup.text: Young Earth creationism reads Genesis literally. It argues Earth is roughly 6,000 years old and evolution is false.

discovery.text: This view emerged in the 20th century. Early Christians like Augustine read Genesis symbolically, not literally.

twist.text: Creationism is mainly an American phenomenon. Most Christians worldwide accept evolution without crisis of faith.

climax.text: The creationism debate is about biblical authority, not science. If Genesis falls, what else in the Bible is myth?

punchline.text: Creationism defends biblical authority. The real fear isn't evolution but doubt.

quiz.question: What is Young Earth creationism?
options: A literal reading of Genesis that says Earth is about 6,000 years old
